title: Environment workflow
content:
This page explains the environment workflow and the steps to perform the following tasks:

  • View workflow and current phase of environment
  • Change phase of environment

Environment workflow

The environment workflow describes the different metaphases and phases in the lifecycle of an environment. Metaphases represent broad stages in the lifecycle, while phases are the specific steps within each stage.

The environment lifecycle consists of the following metaphases:

  • Preparation
  • Operation
  • Ended (End)

The following figure shows the environment workflow.

The following sections describes phases within each metaphase.

Preparation

Phase Description Allowed transitions Transition type
Ready After you create an environment, it is in the Ready phase by default.

Ready to Inactive

Operation

Phase Description Allowed transitions Transition type
In use Move the environment to the In use phase when you plan to run product instances on the environment.

In use to Deactivating

 Manual
Deactivating Move the environment to the Deactivating phase when there are plans to decommision this environment. 

Deactivating to Inactive,

Deactivating to In use

 Manual 

Ended (End)

Phase Description Allowed transitions Transition type
Inactive Move the environment to the Inactive phase if it is no longer hosting the product instances.

Inactive to Ready

 Manual

View workflow and current phase of environment

  1. Click    > Plan > Company.
  2. In the Companies dropdown, click Environments.
  3. Click the ID of the environment.
  4. Click the Workflow tab. This displays the workflow, and the current phase is highlighted in blue.

Change phase of environment

  1. Click    > Plan > Company.
  2. In the Companies dropdown, click Environments. 
  3. Click the ID of the environment.
  4. Click the phase button   on the upper-right side of the page to change the phase to the next phase, or select the appropriate phase from the dropdown.
  5. Click Save.
